name: Cloudflared Web
description:
Cloudflared-web is a docker image that packages both cloudflared CLI and a simple Web UI to easily start or stop remotely-managed Cloudflare tunnels. It provides an easy run-and-forget setup with a user-friendly interface to manage your Cloudflare Zero Trust tunnels without touching the command line.

Features:
- Simple and user-friendly Web UI
- Start and stop Cloudflare tunnel with a single click
- Manage cloudflared token easily
- Basic authentication support
- Configurable tunnel parameters (protocol, region, retries, etc.)
author: WisdomSky

form_fields.label: WebUI Host
form_fields.hint: The host address the WebUI will listen on (default: 0.0.0.0)

form_fields.label: Basic Auth Password
form_fields.hint: Password for Basic Authentication. Leave empty to disable Basic Auth.

form_fields.label: Protocol
form_fields.hint: Protocol for Cloudflare connection: auto, http2, or quic (default: auto)

form_fields.label: Edge IP Version
form_fields.hint: IP version for Cloudflare connection: auto, 4, or 6 (default: auto)

form_fields.label: Region
form_fields.hint: Cloudflare region (e.g., 'us' for United States only). Leave empty for global.

form_fields.label: Retries
form_fields.hint: Maximum number of retries for connection errors (default: 5)

form_fields.label: Grace Period
form_fields.hint: Grace period for shutdown after SIGINT/SIGTERM (default: 30s)

form_fields.label: Metrics Port
form_fields.hint: Port for tunnel metrics (only if metrics enabled)
